> — LucidSDreamr said:


Well yes, when I dose 4 days a week I am TO SOME extent physically dependent, but not so badly that I can't usually get through the 3 days without dosing.


That is probably due to so much in my system from other days because of how much I take though.


But this past week I had to start getting my shit together to start work again (I work in a college so I have winters off)...so I have only dosed once in the past week, 3 days ago, and I can now feel the tiredness and depression lifting.


I've gotten off it a few times now.


What I'd say is I'm LESS physically dependent at 4 days a week than one who takes it 7 days a week...and I think even less than one who takes MUCH less than me if they take it EVERY DAY.


That is up for debate, but I can't help but think that reminding your body you need a FRESH dose every day is worse than any amount left over from previous days.


I will be trying to cut back to 3 days a week, and preferably no 2 days in a row if I can resist the temptation LOL...and try to AT LEAST temporarily stop for 91 days or more within the next month (I say that number because my record  was 90 days and I want to break it).


So yeah...it's a certain level of physical dependence, but I've never had more than SUPER minor RLS, and was told if you don't get BAD RLS your dependency isn't THAT bad.


I'd say that at my maximal doses I have a moderate depenency.


The worst was last month I went 4 days in a row taking my super high doses, and another 5th day in that week which is the only time I've gone 5 in a week  or more than 3 in a row.


That resulted in 4 pretty damn uncomfortable days, 1 somewhat uncomfortable day, on the 6th it was all psychological, so much that doing some shit to cheer me up made the depression go away, and figured I was pretty much off it by the time I dosed on day 7...there could NOT have been much less in my system.


So yeah...some level of dependency...much less this week...but I still believe that refusal to dose more than 4 in a week...even at my heroic doses, keeps me somewhat out of the danger zone of those who just wake up and take it every single day.


Because once you've told yourself you can take it EVERY day, and your tolerance is as high as mine....yeah, there's no way that's turning out well lol...

Has anyone else noticed a really good synergy between Kratom and a benzo? I am prescribed Xanax daily 1 mg but by no means take it daily bc I am very well aware of how severe benzo WD can be. But on a day I do take a Xanax, the Kratom feels amazing. More so than normal. 


It has also helped when I WD from Kratom bc one of my worst symptoms is anxiety. It cures that and since I don't have a tolerance to the Xanax, it also helps me sleep. Phenibut helps with the sleep aspect of WD too but I refuse to take it more than 2 days in a row. But after 2 days, most of the Kratom Wd has passed with the exception of some night sweats. I also find that miserable. Does anyone know of anything that can help with that symptom?

Im sorry but that sounds like terrible advice.  Someone is addicted to a substance and probably has anxiety because of this addiction... and you recommend a benzo?  Benzos are very addictive on their own, and can cause more problems (anxiety especially) than they "treat", been there done that...


Kratom misery:  Unfortunately that's what happens after long periods of kratom use for a lot of people.  The exact mechanism would be tough to point out because of the many different active compounds in the plant material as well as the complexity of our mind & body.  I've been using kratom quite a bit lately; last semester at uni I got a 4.0 in all my classes and I attribute that to kratom use (which means little to no alcohol use or other drug use, consequently, and that's why I take kratom).  The downside is the anxiety that may come with its use, especially when taking 20+ grams a day.


During winter break I jumped off the kratom, it wasn't too bad, but I used loperamide and alcohol.  I felt much better very quickly and the withdrawal was so much milder than I thought it was going to be, I think that's where most of the anxiety came from, the thought of withdrawal.  Taper off man, or just flush it down the toilet and hold on.  You'll be thankful you did it I bet, it sounds like you're subconsciously motivated to get off the stuff.  I wouldn't recommend the alcohol part, but a small dose of loperamide 4-6 hours after your last kratom dose (and maybe 2 or 3 subsequent smaller doses) would give you a very smooth landing my friend.


Take care!

I’m sorry but I STRONGLY disagree.


I also have Generalized Anxiety Disorder and my life would be almost unlivable without Klonopin.


STOP THE WAR ON BENZOS!!


Yes, they are addictive.


Yes, they have side effects.


So do all drugs.


But they have legit medical uses and are LIFE SAVERS for those who need them.


Let people make their own fucking decisions about what drugs they want to put in their bodies.


And this isn’t even for recreation but FOR RELIEF.


I haven’t gotten worse anxiety from my benzo use, and I haven’t had many negative side effects.


They COULD happen down the line, but it’s a risk I’m willing to take for now and later on if I want to try to get off them (which in theory would be nice some day) then  I will, but NOT based on anyone telling me I SHOULD (UNLESS  it’s a doctor telling me I’m going to do PERMAMENT damage that will be REALLY bad if I don’t).


Yes, this is a harm reduction site, but I think people forget about PSYCHOLOGICAL harm reduction (i.e. helping people use certain substances safely if those substances really CAN improve their state of mind, help them emotionally or physically).


Don’t throw out the baby with the bath water.


Every one jumps on benzos saying they are so horrible, but when the shoe’s on the other foot and you have a serious anxiety disorder that responds to nothing else, then unless you are a doctor (and really, even if you are IMO) you shouldn’t be talking.


Our bodies, our choice.

**Kratom = WOW (Strain?)**


Hey y'all, sorry was on vacation for couple weeks, but anyway...


Back story:

So before I planned the vacation, I relapsed on opiates for the 2nd time in almost 3.5 years, a couple days before Christmas, and the first time was this past October, for thank god only a 3 week run. Still ashamed I blew all that clean time off opiates. But as the vacation date got closer, so did my fears of withdrawal, since I didn't plan on being dumb and sneaking drugs thru customs, I decided to order enough powdered kratom to last me. 

But I was really scared and even regretted my decision completely while on the plane, why? Well because I was always a doubter of kratom, I never expressed my doubts since I never tried it but I was almost sure it didn't work like they say...


Conclusion:

i was wrong for damn sure....Now I don't understand how people don't think it completely eliminates withdrawal lol, because it did for me at least. Very impressed and very upset I never gave it a shot sooner. Why it's not used instead of suboxone beats me. It should be studied more, so they can replace it with other narcos, and so we know the long term health effects (if any at all) . 

What I enjoyed most is that this life saving leaf doesn't achieve that real opiate high, so it doesn't make u fien, crave, ruin ur life, etc.. but comes with confidence, energy (depending on strain) , and mild euphoria. It's like it's own unique high.

Now I ordered more and received it and I plan to continue this for about 3 months only , BUT I do know that it comes with withdrawals that people say are quick but just as harsh as a true opiate WD. But I'll look more into it wen that time comes, but for now...


Question on Euphoria:

Have you ever taken a prescription opioid before? I'd compare it to taking a low-dose of something like hydrocodone, personally, like taking 10 or 15 mgs or so. But it's also different...I dunno, I've found that it has more of an energizing effect to it, and not so much a sedating effect. 


It seems like it's a highly variable and subjective substance though, generally-speaking. Some people don't care for it at all, either because they've become accustomed to high-strength opioid drugs and that's all they're into now, or they're just a non-responder to it. I know that, for me personally, I'm not really into the extracts that much...even one can make me feel a bit queasy if I hadn't consumed kratom recently. 


Personally I just take a rounded tablespoon of some high-quality kratom powder and wash it down with some iced tea. I'd just try some different strains and products and, if you aren't getting any effects, well, you gave it a try right? High doses of kratom are pointless IMO, after a certain amount all you get is sick from consuming more

I'm not the person you asked, but here's my thoughts.

I take between 4.5 and 6 mg of red bali kratom once per day. (I buy 48 capsules at a time and usually don't take it every day, just those days where I have some capsules left). It does give a similar effect of lower dose hydrocodone, like 10mg-ish yeah. (Been years since I've taken hydro so I can't say for certain on dosage equivalency)

I haven't timed it, but it seems to last me a good 2-3 hours before it wears off. It comes with some euphoria, uplifted mood, and some painkiller effects. For me, I started taking it to fight off heroin cravings. When I take kratom and for the next day after, I find that I have little to no heroin cravings. But 48+ hours and it's back to the usual.

I imagine kratom can be taken for various reasons. Mine are recreational and to fight cravings/urges for heavy shit.

what matters more than anything is finding high quality kratom products, you may want to test out several brands. I'd offer some but I'm in the US and they probably aren't over there.


any of the colors, strains, basically everything is going to aid in withdrawal by similar amounts, the only real difference is the amount of stimulation it provides along with the basic opioid effect... although red strains are generally about 10-20% less potent than green/white strains, this doesn't make them inferior


White is the most stimulating, will keep you awake at night, provides a stimmy dopamine buzz which Red does not, but also has more side effects in high or repeated doses. Green is a mix of white and red, probably the most popular color. Red is the most relaxing, best before bedtime, closest to a real opioid in comparison. Generally I advise people get a mix of a few strains rather than a bigger bag of one. Different vendors and different batches can vary wildly in quality, especially with the state of the international market these days.


If you are going through major withdrawals from good heroin, you're definitely going to want to acquire some extracts if you can afford them. Mostly because extracts can provide a stronger effect with less side effects, and in this regard they are superior to powder.
